title: Strategies for Utilizing the Collaborative Instructional Design System (CIDS) to Implement 21st-Century Pedagogy and Higher-Order Thinking Skills (HOTS)

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental instructional design principles, understanding of elementary curricula
context.additional_context: A collaborative learning environment designed to strengthen 21st-century teaching methods and HOTS (Higher Order Thinking Skills) implementation capabilities, centered on language subjects for pre-service and current elementary school teachers

learning_goals: Learners collaborate with peer teachers using the ASIE model of the Collaborative Instructional Design System (CIDS) to develop three or more HOTS-based lesson plans.
Learners conduct two or more peer feedback sessions by applying Professional Learning Community (PLC) operational guidelines.
Learners analyze shared lesson cases via an LMS platform, extract five or more 21st-century teaching elements, and apply them to actual lessons.

resources: Collaborative learning tools (Padlet, Google Jamboard, etc.)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
